titleStmt.title: An answer to certain observations of W. Bridges, concerning the present warre against His Majestie whereby hee pretends to justifie it against that hexapla of considerations, viz. theologicall, historicall, legall, criticall, melancholy, and foolish : wherein, as he saith, it is look't upon by the squint-eyed multitude.
titleStmt.author: Warmstry, Thomas, 1610-1665.

notesStmt.note: A reply to William Bridge's Ioabs covnsell and King Davids seasonable hearing it, delivered in a sermon before the honourable House of Commons ... by W. Bridges. London, 1643.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
